IBM Multicloud Management Platform - MCMP

Published on 22 Mar 2024 by Suresh Babu

Photoshop HTML5 CSS3 Object Oriented JavaScript Angular Webpack NPM Micro Service Architecture Docker Kubernetes

The project aimed to create a self-service store that empowers users to seamlessly browse, search, order, and fulfil cloud services. As the Tech Lead UI, I played a pivotal role in bringing this vision to life.

Initiation and Landscape:

Throughout the development process, we leveraged a range of cutting-edge technologies including HTML, CSS, Object-Oriented JavaScript & ES6, Angular, Webpack, Jasmine, NPM, Micro Service Architecture, Docker, Kubernetes, and the Carbon Design System. Incorporating the Carbon Design System, an open-source system for building digital products, ensured consistency, accessibility, and scalability in our user interface designs

My journey with the IBM Multicloud Management Platform (MCMP) began in January 2018 when I took on the role of Tech Lead UI.

Responsibilities:

My responsibilities encompassed various facets of the project, from tailoring user experiences to implementing responsive design for mobile sites. Leveraging the components and guidelines provided by the Carbon Design System, I worked closely with designers to translate their concepts into functional interfaces using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Additionally, I contributed to the backend by collaborating on APIs and ensuring seamless integration with the frontend. Throughout the development lifecycle, I maintained software workflow management using tools like GitHub and task runners such as Grunt and Webpack.

I have provided consultation on new JavaScript features and integrated them into our codebase to enhance performance and functionality while adhering to the principles of the Carbon Design System.

Acceptance Criteria and User Testing:

During development, we meticulously defined acceptance criteria to ensure that each feature met the highest standards of quality and usability. We crafted detailed use-cases to guide our development process, covering scenarios such as user registration, service browsing, order placement, and fulfilment. User testing played a crucial role in refining the platform, allowing us to gather valuable feedback and iterate on features to enhance user satisfaction while maintaining consistency with the Carbon Design System.

Reception and Review

Upon its launch, the IBM Multicloud Management Platform garnered positive reception from users and stakeholders alike. Its intuitive interface, seamless navigation, and robust functionality were lauded for simplifying the cloud service procurement process. The platform's ability to streamline operations and improve efficiency was widely recognized, cementing its position as a cornerstone of IBM's cloud offerings.

Business Logic and Impact: The MCMP's underlying business logic was designed to optimize resource allocation, reduce overhead costs, and accelerate the provisioning of cloud services. By centralizing the procurement process and providing users with a self-service interface, the platform empowered organizations to swiftly adapt to changing business needs and capitalize on cloud technologies.

Its impact extended beyond individual users, driving organizational agility and fostering innovation across diverse industries.

"My journey with the IBM Multicloud Management Platform has been a rewarding one, marked by collaboration, innovation, and tangible impact. As the Tech Lead UI, I am proud to have contributed to the success of this transformative project, leveraging the power of the Carbon Design System to create an exceptional user experience."
